programme.title: Texas Rising
programme.desc: Hays and Bigfoot's hands are forced when the Empresario enlists them to protect the town from a Comanche attack. Elsewhere, Emily arouses Santa Anna's suspicions.

programme.title: Monster Croc Wrangler
programme.desc: Matt Wright's challenge is to capture a dangerous crocodile that has been creeping worryingly close to humans and cattle, but relocating the 16ft killer by helicopter will not be an easy task.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts investigate mysterious beings with big heads and eyes, whose images were found carved into rocks. Known as the 'greys', they are rumoured to be alien life forms.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts analyse whether natural causes were responsible for the volcanoes, earthquakes and floods of ancient times - and the possibility that it was down to aliens.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: With over 40,000 wristbands to sell, stored in 126 boxes, Les decides to sell them one by one, starting at $2 apiece. Seth and Ashley remain sceptical of the idea.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth and Ashley make a series of bets to see if they or Les can purchase any item that comes into the store that they would otherwise dismiss as 'junk'.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth notices that Ashley is behaving strangely - either low-balling on, or rejecting outright, various items that she would otherwise give higher deals on.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley continues to low-ball and mistreat customers to Seth's detriment, and gets involved in an argument in front of a client over a signed 1970 Detroit Tigers baseball.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: A customer pays the team $10,000 to restore a 1950s soda fountain - and expects to get his money's worth. The guys also try to restore a vintage phone box.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick is asked to make a barber's chair look like a sports car, while Tyler and Ron deal with a disagreement by playing pranks on each other.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Jack Whitehall, Katherine Ryan, Rich Hall
programme.desc: An evening of stand-up at the Apollo in Hammersmith, London. Jack Whitehall is the man in charge, treating the audience to his own brand of humour, before introducing routines by Canadian comedienne Katherine Ryan and American jokester Rich Hall.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Host Dara O Briain and regulars Hugh Dennis and Andy Parsons are joined by Rob Beckett, Susan Calman, Hal Cruttenden and Romesh Ranganathan on an edition of the comedy quiz first aired in July 2014. The panellists give their take on that week's major news stories and participate in a series of stand-up spots and improvised games.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Comedian Rhod Gilbert takes over the reins for an extended edition of the satirical quiz, with broadcaster and journalist Emma Barnett and stand-up Tom Allen joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: Rhod Gilbert's Work Experience
programme.desc: The comedian takes a job in a hair and beauty salon, quickly believing himself ready to work on real customers as he tries an all-over tan and perfects his own unique version of the bob.

programme.title: Asian Provocateur
programme.desc: Comedian Romesh Ranganathan sets out on another international odyssey to meet members of his extended family. This time, he meet relatives who left Sri Lanka and settled in the USA, and by visiting them in Florida, Romesh hopes to get a taste of what his life could have been like if his parents had opted to migrate to the US instead of the UK. However, for this trip, his mother Shanthi is tagging along, as she fulfils her dream of visiting her relatives across the Atlantic. Marshalled by his cousin Pratheep, who has arranged a week of all-American entertainment, Romesh and his mother sample life stateside, but when Romesh ditches Shanthi to attend a beer-chugging Frat initiation, things begin to turn sour between the pair.

programme.title: Rhod Gilbert's Work Experience
programme.desc: The comedian's sense of humour is put to the test when he is sent to the Brecon Beacons to take part in one of the British Army's most gruelling training exercises.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Tim Warwood and Adam Gendle travel around the country to complete a variety of outlandish stunts, beginning with an attempt to bounce a man across a lake and into a target.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Last Post
programme.desc: Drama about military police and their families faced with political and personal conflicts in a 1960s British colony on the Red Sea coast. An officer and his wife arrive in Aden, where he is to replace a much-loved captain. He soon has to adjust to life on the frontline, along with resentment among the men that he was appointed instead of the already-present Lt Ed Laithwaite. Honor is taken under the wing of Laithwaite's wife, Alison, who had been having an affair with Captain Page. Starring Jessie Buckley and Jeremy Neumark Jones.

programme.title: Tess of the D'Urbervilles
programme.desc: Angel and Tess are on their honeymoon when he decides it is time for them to admit their former transgressions, but while she forgives his, he is appalled by what his new wife tells him and heads off to Brazil to set up a farm there by himself. She then finds a job on a bleak farm run by Groby and bumps into Alec, who claims he is a changed man and proposes marriage. Gemma Arterton stars.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: A reluctant Brian enters an addiction centre run by monks to treat his alcoholism, but soon becomes bored and looks for a distraction. He finds one when a chance remark leads the team to reopen an investigation into the death of a heroin user nine years previously - and to help reveal the truth, Gerry is sent undercover as a sex addict. Richard Wilson and Fay Ripley guest star.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Jack examines a case previously undertaken by a deceased colleague, who was convinced that the alleged suicide of a journalist was a cover-up by the American government. Enlisting the help of a UFO-spotter, the team discovers the reporter witnessed a mysterious air crash near a US Air Force base, and the retired officers try to track down the original personnel to get some answers. Guest starring Mark Williams, Glynis Barber, Michael Brandon and Raquel Cassidy, with Amanda Redman.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Sky Midnight News
programme.desc: Update on the day's headlines, plus a weather report.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Sky News on the Hour
programme.desc: Review of the latest international news, with sport, weather and financial updates.

programme.title: Sky News on the Hour
programme.desc: Review of the latest international news, with sport, weather and financial updates.

programme.title: The Pledge
programme.desc: The panel members debate more of the big issues the whole country is talking about.

programme.title: World News
programme.desc: A comprehensive look at the biggest stories from around the globe.

programme.title: Sky World Review & Business Report
programme.desc: The biggest stories from around the globe. Including weather, sports and business news.

programme.title: World News
programme.desc: A comprehensive look at the biggest stories from around the globe.

programme.title: Sky World Review & Business Report
programme.desc: The biggest stories from around the globe. Including weather, sports and business news.

programme.title: World News
programme.desc: A comprehensive look at the biggest stories from around the globe.

programme.title: Sophy Ridge on Sunday
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest news headlines, plus analysis of current affairs issues with leading politicians, a review of stories in the day's national newspapers and weather reports.

programme.title: Heathrow: Britain's Busiest Airport
programme.desc: The documentary going behind the scenes of the London airport returns for a fifth season. Inside the terminal, seasoned pro Demi dishes out deals for delayed passengers, while outside on the airfield, Ian is on the runway as it goes into lockdown with a full armed police presence. For the first time this series, viewers will also see the work of the Border Force's canine drugs detection team - Rachel and her dog Cole, who in his career has intercepted more than Â£1million worth of class-A contraband. Narrated by Julie Walters.

programme.title: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Documentary looking at crashes, miracle escapes and bad driving - with dramatic video and interviews from victims and eyewitnesses. Narrated by Jamie Theakston.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: 90s vs 00s: The Love Songs
programme.desc: It's the ultimate battle of the decades! We're putting the love songs from the 90s up against the love songs of the 00s to see who did it best.

programme.title: Late Night Magic
programme.desc: We're taking you all the way through the night with soem of the best tracks of all time.

programme.title: The Kisstory Takeover
programme.desc: Kisstory is taking over with non-stop old skool and anthems.

programme.title: Up All Night! Kiss Beats
programme.desc: Let the world sleep! But here at Kiss we are still up, still delivering the finest beats for your nocturnal jam.

programme.title: Chart Hits & New Vids
programme.desc: We've got all the hits that are storming the charts right now, along with some brand new releases from your favourite and new artists.

programme.title: Hit After Hit
programme.desc: Nothing but the biggest hits by your favourite stars back to back.

programme.title: Hunting Hitler
programme.desc: The team investigates a secret U-Boat docking station that could have aided Hitler's escape from Europe, and discover a sunken sub near Caleta de Loros.

programme.title: Treasure Quest: Snake Island
programme.desc: A deadly caiman targets Mehgan, and a potentially crippling accident leads to a shocking find - a coded message from the past that may bring the prospectors closer to gold.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini investigates a lead on a 1956 Citroen 2CV in North Carolina, as he suspects it could be one of the first of its kind to be imported into the US.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini recommisions his 1934 Lincoln KB convertible for the Keels & Wheels concours in Texas.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Jr cracks out the chrome for the chopper and it's looking good. And Mikey wants to prove a point on the racetrack but can he keep up with the pace guy?.

programme.title: Fantomworks
programme.desc: Emmett believes his 1964 Barracuda is all original, but Dan finds out that the car has a past that nobody expected. Plus, Dan fixes a 1953 Studebaker Commande.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: Salvage aficionado Drew Pritchard teams up with Turbo Pickers' Paul Cowland for a motoring mission. The duo head to Staffordshire on the trail of a Ford Capri. They find a beauty, but it's got tatty bodywork and needs a new interior.

programme.title: Snooker: Welsh Open
programme.desc: Action from the final in Cardiff.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Following the lives of people, each weighing over 600lbs. Through their year-long journeys, they attempt to lose thousands of pounds collectively, to survive..

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: The search for a murder suspect that led police to arrest two conspirators involved in the plot, who later implicated the victim's ex-husband.

programme.title: The Murder Tapes
programme.desc: The case of retired preacher and coin collector Billy Shuler. After he was found murdered, the case slowly unravelled until someone came forward to identify his killer.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: A case in which two college students were gunned down while parked in a quiet lovers' lane. Residents of the tiny community of Juliette, Georgia, were beside themselves with panic.

programme.title: Pamela Smart: An American Murder Mystery
programme.desc: As the trial continues, the prosecution plays secret audio recordings that shock the courtroom. However, Pam insists she wasn't involved in her husband's death.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: Investigator Amy-Jo Meadows spots a little dog in trouble, criss-crossing the five lanes of traffic on busy Seventh Street, and has to work out how to get him off the road.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown heads to Victoria, where he trims the tusks of 220kg pig, tries to keep a three-legged cow on its feet and treats a dizzy dog.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A bride-to-be brings scorecards to rate her gowns, while another has her first fitting. Plus, the annual Blowout Sale begins.
